constituent: provisions, rice, quantity, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor, computer
koohiiStory1: Imagine Japanese army provisions like obentou boxes, always containing the same quantity of rice. (thanks darg_sama, emphasizing quantity and the nuance of food "rations", "food supply": the kanji also appears in "military provisions" and "army rice").
koohiiStory2: All Japanese provisions contain a certain quantity of rice... they eat it with just about every meal!
myStory: chữ lương. thức ăn, lương thực. mễ + lượng. lượng đồ ăn là lương
readingExamples: 糧食 (かてしょく), 糧道 (りょうどう), 糧 (かて)
